overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students learn the definition of constraints. They write a system of linear inequalities to model a situation and graph the system, determining that overlapping shaded regions identify the possible solutions to the system. They practice graphing several systems of inequalities and determining the solution set. Finally, students match systems, graphs, and possible solutions of systems.

overview_item_data_items: I can represent constraints in a problem situation with systems of inequalities.
I can write and graph systems of linear inequalities.
I can interpret the solutions of systems of inequalities mathematically and in the context of real-world problems.
I can graph the solutions to a system of linear inequalities in two variables as the intersection of the corresponding half-planes.
In a system of linear inequalities, the inequalities are known as constraints because the values of the expressions are constrained to lie within a certain region.
The solution to a system of linear inequalities is the intersection of the solutions to each inequality. Every point in the intersecting region satisfies all inequalities in the system.

overview_item_data_group_items: solution of a system of linear inequalities

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students consider a situation and share quantities that meet the given goal.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Determining Solutions to Systems of Linear Inequalities
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students write and graph a system of linear inequalities to represent a situation.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Analyzing Graphs of Systems of Linear Inequalities
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students graph a system of linear inequalities and use algebra to determine whether a point is a solution.
Students use a system of inequalities to solve a real-world problem.
Students compare the solution to a system of linear equations and the solution to a system of linear inequalities.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
